author: schone_wizard
content: I am asking because I don't understand.  In the past it was discussed that when a validator exits, the funds are put on hold for a bit to let anybody who has evidence of a slashable offense submit one.  My question was then, if that same validator gets their miner tips for blocks they proposed in the execution layer, and spends them right away.  Does that not defeat partly the purpose of being able to penalize and withhold said funds from said validator

author: schone_wizard
content: now i realize the two aren't related... but one is allowed to be spent right away by the virtue of how its disbursed (because that's how it is now and we don't want to change it) though its received as compensation for something that in the new paradigm should be penalize-able

author: schone_wizard
content: to put it into numbers.  Validator commits some slashable offense and have accumulated above their 32ETH up to 33ETH, so 1ETH.  That part will be slashed.  But on the execution side of things they got lets say 0.5ETH in total in tips, that has been long gone and spent.

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> Slashing is only up to the 32 eth principle

author: schone_wizard
content: okay but still, my question about the concept remains.  one side is slashable, the other is spendable right away.

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> Validators are only ever "securing" the network with that 32 eth

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> It is also expected that balances in excess of 32 will be withdrawable in an express fashion

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> So yes, rewards achieved on top of the 32 eth for doing validator things are not subject to the same lockups and slashings as the principle itself

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> also all fees and capture of MEV and bypass COINBASE through side-channels and EVM payment to an alternative address

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> so sending it forceable to the validator account or to the COINBASE in the EVM is a moot point really

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> because the validator can use mechanisms to bypass it. Whereas they can’t make their 32 ETH base balance disappear and can’t reroute issuance from the core protocol

author: schone_wizard
content: okay so that settles that.  thank you for taking the time to explain

author: imman6820
content:
How about a validator that has some inactivity leak down to 31 eth. Then comes online and gets a MEV reward of 1 eth.
Would that reward be immediately withdrawable or go towards the 32 eth requirement?

author: jgm
content: Execution layer rewards are not added to consensus layer balance.

author: ajsutton
content: But notably attestation rewards would still only be paid based on the 31ETH effective balance so they’ll be earning less from that (and still have plenty on the line to be slashed if need be)

content: I think <@710066339045179464> meant if they’d withdraw it right there on the spot. Then deposit it into their validator balance
